reference.title: CODES command
reference.shortdesc: The optional CODES command restricts which log record types the SCRUB command writes to the output IMS log.

refbody.section: CODES does not affect which record types are scrubbed.

refsyn.title: Syntax
refsyn.p: You can specify individual log record types and ranges of log record types, in any combination.
Each type can be either a 2-digit hexadecimal value (a log record type, such as 01) or a 4-digit hexadecimal value (a log record type followed by a subtype, such as 5901).

example.title: Examples
example.p: If you omit the CODES command, the SCRUB command writes all log record types, as if you had specified the following CODES command:
The following example excludes user log records from the output IMS log:
A SYSIN data set can contain multiple CODES commands. The following single command:
is equivalent to the following commands:
example.codeblock: CODES(01) CODES(03) CODES(40-45) CODES(67FF) CODES(50) CODES(5901-59FF)
